page.title: 12WORK & LEISURE IN WOODBORO'
page.content:
A 1984 survey of Woodborough showed this break-down of occupations:
Professional 29.4% Intermediate 47.1% Skilled manual 4.9% Skilled non-manual 4.9% Unskilled 13.7% Market-gardeners,farmers,builders, garage-mechanics,coalmen and joiners are the jobs people do round here. There are clubs for: badminton,football,cricket,scrabble, tennis and local history.Some folk are not in employment,others are bankers,insurance-workers or shop-workers in Nottingham itself. One man,a banker in the city,spends 45 hrs.at work,4.5 at leisure,and six days on holiday a year.One boy spends Friday:8.00 up,9.00 school,3.45 home, play,T.V.,5.00 tea,6.00 cubs,8.30 bed.
